result.execSummary:
The defendant David J Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David J Coleman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David J Coleman was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • David J Coleman was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • David J Coleman was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order

supervisions.notes: Consec to 15CF470. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.
Psychiatric/psychological evaluation as deemed appropriate by agent and treatment as recommended.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with AV.  Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward TC or any other person. Not go into Knuckleheads on State St in Madison.

Completion of certified domestic violence treatment.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

Upon review and consideration of all the pleadings, filings, correspondence and proceedings relevant hereto, regarding sentencen credit, the Court finds that no legal authority has been cited in support of the requested relief, an insufficient factual basis has been articulated supporting the requested relief and credit applied to 15CF470 has all been used. Now therefore, based upon the Findings of the court, the requested relief is hereby is Denied: Credit used in 15CF470 - These consecutive to 15CF470

AMENDED CASH BOND - CONDITIONS MODIFIED
- Cash bond is set in the amount of $7,500 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 AM on the business day following his/her release from jail.
- If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not use, possess or consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not be at Knucklehead's Tobacco and Gifts.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, Tracy C. or Alexander V.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
- The Court finds substantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur.  The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969.
Trial Judge - Br 5

Reporter: Heather Kieta
